result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Elijah Adams-Washington

Defendant Joshua Elijah Adams-Washington in court.  Attorney William F Sulton in court for Joshua Elijah Adams-Washington.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Defense motion to suppress heard.  Sworn for the stateL  MPD Officers Ryan Clementz and Chad Boysack.  Exhibit #1 received.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Argument heard.  Court ordered matter adjourned for decision.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Decision scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
At the request of the State the 8/11/22 motion hearing is rescheduled to 10/4/2022 at 10:00 am. All parties notified.
Received and Filed, forwarded to Judge for review.
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 07/07/2022 to repay Milwaukee County $75 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 7/1/2022. th

Defendant Joshua Elijah Adams-Washington in court with attorney William F Sulton.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Matter not on court calendar and was called at the request of Atty. Sulton.  Atty. Sulton has filed a motion to suppress and requests a briefing schedule and motion hearing date.  Court ordered the state to file a response with the court no later than 7/15/22; defense to file reply no later than 7/25/22.  The 6/27/22 status conference is vacated.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Appointing Counsel at County Expense, signed and filed.  rmm

Defendant Joshua Elijah Adams-Washington in court.  
Brandon Schwebler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints William Sulton as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Sulton accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $75.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 7/01/22 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

22RM026733  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/26/2022 sa
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joshua Elijah Adams-Washington in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 01.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/10/2022@1:30pm
